alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 1:50PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Delaware, central Jackson and southwestern Dubuque Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 149 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms producing funnel clouds along a line extending from Greeley to near Andrew. Movement was northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and possibly weak, brief tornadoes. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Isolated damage to roofs, siding and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Dyersville, Epworth, Farley, Peosta, Edgewood, Andrew, New Vienna, Colesburg, Worthington, La Motte, Greeley, Springbrook, Bernard, Zwingle, Bankston, Fulton, Otter Creek, South Gary Owen, Garry Owen and Fillmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds have been reported across the area. Conditions remain favorable for additional funnel clouds, and possibly brief, weak tornadoes. The National Weather Service will continue to closely monitor the situation, and may issue a Tornado Warning if the threat increases. If you see a funnel cloud or tornado, seek shelter indoors and then contact your local law enforcement agency for relay to the National Weather Service.
